Class Breakout

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      acm.program.Program
                          acm.program.GraphicsProgram
                              Breakout
All Implemented Interfaces:
acm.io.IOModel, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class Breakout
extends acm.program.GraphicsProgram
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

Breakout is a game invented by Steve Wozniak before he founded Apple. The colored rectangles in the top part of the screen are bricks, and the slightly larger rectangle at the bottom is the paddle. The paddle is in a fixed position in the vertical dimension, but moves back and forth across the screen along with the mouse until it reaches the edge of its space. A complete game consists of three turns. On each turn, a ball is launched from the center of the window toward the bottom of the screen at a random angle. That ball bounces off the paddle and the walls of the world, in accordance with the physical principle generally expressed as “the angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection”. The play on a turn continues in this way until one of two conditions occurs: 1. The ball hits the lower wall, which means that the player must have missed it with the paddle. In this case, the turn ends and the next ball is served if the player has any turns left. If not, the game ends in a loss for the player. 2. The last brick is eliminated. In this case, the player wins, and the game ends immediately. (Citation: Mehran Sahami, CS106A, Handout #19, October 15, 2007)

Author:
trung
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

run

public void run()
Runs the Breakout program.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class acm.program.GraphicsProgram

drawMessage

private void drawMessage(java.lang.String s)
Draw a big red message in the middle of the screen.

win

private void win()
Execute the wining congratulation Precon: All bricks are removed. Postcon: Wining message appeared.

lose

private void lose()
Execute the losing notice Precon: All life is lost. Postcon: Losing message appeared.

reset

private void reset()
Reset the game back to the original state. The removed bricks won't be re-initialized to decrease difficulty. Precon: The ball hit the lower wall. Postcon: The ball and paddle are re-initialized.

mouseMoved

public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Move the paddle whenever the mouse is moved in the blankArea. Precon: Mouse motion is detected. Postcon: The paddle's X corrdinate is set to the mouse's X coordinate plus half of PADDLE_WIDTH.

Specified by:
mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
Overrides:
mouseMoved in class acm.program.Program

checkCollision

private void checkCollision()
Check for collision between the ball and other object and act accordingly. Precon: None. Postcon: if collision detected with brick, the brick is removed and totalbricks is decreased. If collided with wall or paddle then bounce back.

checkPaddleCollision

private void checkPaddleCollision()
Check for collision between the ball and the paddle. Bounce the wall if detected. The ball won't bounce if it is travelling up and hit the paddle to prevent rapid bouncing edge cases.

checkWallCollision

private void checkWallCollision()
Check for wall collision. Ball will bounce if wall detected.

checkBrickCollision

private void checkBrickCollision()
Check for brick collision. If collided, ball will bounce and brick will be destroyed.

bounce

private void bounce()
Invert the vY of the ball and play the bouncing sound.

collided

private boolean collided()
Check if the ball is colliding with anything.

Returns:
true if one of the corners detects collision.

updateBallCollider

private void updateBallCollider()
Update the ball collider set of points.

updatePaddleCollider

private void updatePaddleCollider()
Update the paddle collider set of points.

updateScore

private void updateScore()
Update the score on the scoreboard.

removeBrick

private void removeBrick(acm.graphics.GPoint point)
Check if the element at the GPoint point is a brick. If yes, remove it and decrease totalBricks.

isBrick

private boolean isBrick(acm.graphics.GPoint point)
Check if the element currently at this point is a brick.

Parameters:
point - GPoint object that have x and y coordinates.
Returns:
true if element is a brick, false otherwise.

isPaddle

private boolean isPaddle(acm.graphics.GPoint point)
Check if the element currently at this point is the paddle.

Parameters:
point - GPoint object with x and y coordinates.
Returns:
true if element is the paddle, false otherwise.

initScene

private void initScene()
Initialize the scene, including the blankArea, the bricks, the ball and the paddle. Precon: None. Postcon: The blankArea, the ball, and the paddle are initilized. Bricks are drawn.

initRGen

private void initRGen()
Initialize the RandomGenerator needed to randomize vX. Precon: None. Postcon: vX, vY are initialized.

initBlankArea

private void initBlankArea()
Initialize a GRect object "blank area" in which the mouse motion is detected. Precon: class need to implements MouseMotionListener interface. Postcon: blankArea initialized with MouseMotionListener added.

initBall

private void initBall()
Initialize the ball as a new GOval object. Precon: None. Postcon: The ball is initialized at the middle of the screen, falling downward with a randomized vX and a vY of 3.0.

initPaddle

private void initPaddle()
Initialize the paddle as a new GRect object. Precon: None. Postcon: The paddle is initialized 30 pixel from the bottom of the screen.

initScoreBoard

private void initScoreBoard()
Initialize a GLabel object that display the current score of the player.

drawAllBrick

private void drawAllBrick()
Draw all the bricks as new GRect with their corresponding colors. Precon: None. Postcon: A total of NBRICKS_PER_ROW*NBRICK_ROWS is drawn on the play field with specified color.

drawBrick

private void drawBrick(int x,
                       int y,
                       java.awt.Color color)
Draw a brick with dimensions BRICK_WIDTH, BRICK_HEIGHT at the specified location with the specified color.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the brick.
y - The Y coordinate of the brick.
color - The color of the brick.
